security.title: Security and compliance
security.subtitle: Data protection and traceability in every operation.
security.item1Text: Granular control by operational profile. Each user accesses only the information necessary for their function, with permissions configurable by jurisdiction and type of operation.
security.item2Text: Immutable record of all accesses and actions. Complete traceability of who did what, when and from where, with protected and exportable logs for investigations.
security.item3Text: Distinction between original and derivative. Each piece of evidence retains its cryptographic hash, immutable metadata and record of all copies or modifications made.
security.item4Text: Configurable retention policies aligned with current regulations and personal data protection regulations, including the right to be forgotten.
security.feature1Text: Evidence, messages and attachments are stored and transmitted using strong encryption to prevent unauthorized access.
security.feature2Text: Enhanced access with double verification for commanders, operators and platform administrators.
security.feature3Text: Automatic session closures on inactive devices to reduce risks in the field and in offices.
security.feature4Text: Detailed and non-editable history of each action, ideal for expert assessments, internal audits and reports to the comptroller's office.
security.feature5Text: Frequent backups on secure infrastructure to ensure operational continuity.
security.feature6Text: Configurable to align with internal policies, municipal ordinances and the institution's security standards.
security.faq1Answer: Evidence is stored with end-to-end encryption and immutable metadata (hash, date, location, author). Each change is recorded in the audit log to maintain complete traceability.
security.faq2Question: What happens if there is no internet?
security.faq2Answer: The app works in offline mode. Records and evidence are stored locally and securely synchronized when the connection is restored, without losing critical information.
security.faq3Answer: Only users with explicit permissions can access the original evidence. The rest of the profiles operate with partial views or anonymized data, according to the policy defined by the institution.

help.searchPlaceholder: What do you need to learn?

welcome.title: Welcome to Secured
welcome.content: Secured is an intelligent coordination platform that connects police and security personnel for faster and more efficient response to security incidents.
welcome.tip: Secured is designed to be intuitive and easy to use, even in high-pressure situations.

features.title: Main Features
features.content: The platform offers real-time incident management, instant communication, interactive maps, automatic unit assignment and data analysis to optimize operations.

roles.title: Roles and Permissions
roles.content: Secured has different roles: Operators (manage incidents), Field agents (respond to emergencies) and Supervisors (monitor operations).
roles.tip: Your role determines which functions you can access. Contact your supervisor if you need additional permissions.

interface.title: Main Interface
interface.content: The main screen shows a central map with active incidents, notification panel, side menu for quick access and top bar with your profile and settings.
list: Top bar with profile and settings

ready.title: Ready to Start!
ready.content: You now know the basics of Secured. Explore the other help sections to learn specific functions or start using the platform directly.
ready.tip: Remember: you can always return to this help section from anywhere in the platform.

access.title: Access to Settings
access.content: To access settings, click on your profile picture in the upper right corner and select "Settings" from the drop-down menu.
access.tip: You can also access quickly with the keyboard shortcut Ctrl + Comma (,).

profile.title: Personal Profile
profile.content: In the Profile section you can update your photo, name, email, contact phone and change your password securely.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.content: Configure how and when to receive notifications. You can activate alerts by sound, vibration, push notifications and set quiet hours.
notifications.tip: Critical notifications will always be displayed, even in silent mode.

mapPrefs.title: Map Preferences
mapPrefs.content: Customize map display: style (satellite or streets), default zoom, visible layers and automatic position update.

save.title: Save Changes
save.content: Once everything is configured to your liking, don't forget to click "Save changes" at the bottom of each section. Your preferences will sync across all your devices.
save.tip: Changes are saved automatically every 30 seconds.

create.title: Create an Incident
create.description: How to report a new incident

access.title: Access the Form
access.content: Click the floating "+" button in the lower right corner or select "New incident" from the main menu.
access.tip: You can also create an incident by right-clicking on the map.

basic.title: Basic Data
basic.content: Complete the incident type, priority level (low, medium, high, critical), exact location and detailed description of the event.

additional.title: Additional Information
additional.content: Add relevant details such as number of people involved, presence of weapons, vehicles involved and any information that helps the response.
additional.tip: The more detailed the information, the more effective the response will be.

evidence.title: Attach Evidence
evidence.content: You can attach photos, videos, audio recordings or relevant documents. These files are stored securely and encrypted.

submit.title: Submit Incident
submit.content: Review all information and click "Create incident". A unique code will be assigned and available units will be automatically notified.
submit.tip: The system will automatically prioritize critical incidents for immediate assignment.

assign.title: Assign Units
assign.description: How to assign personnel to an incident

select.title: Select Incident
select.content: From the incident panel or map, click on the incident you want to assign a unit to. The full detail will open.
select.tip: Unassigned incidents appear in red on the map.

view.title: View Available Units
view.content: The system automatically displays the closest and available units, with their estimated distance, arrival time and current status.

choose.title: Select Unit
choose.content: Choose the most appropriate unit considering distance, resources and experience. You can assign multiple units if the situation requires it.
choose.tip: The system automatically recommends the best option based on multiple factors.

confirm.title: Confirm Assignment
confirm.content: Review the information and confirm the assignment. The unit will receive an instant notification with all incident details.

track.title: Tracking
track.content: Once assigned, you can track the unit's location in real time, view its updated ETA and maintain constant communication until the incident is resolved.
track.tip: You can reassign or add more units at any time if necessary.

movement.title: Movement and Zoom
movement.content: Drag with mouse or finger to move around the map. Use mouse wheel, +/- buttons or pinch with two fingers to zoom.

layers.title: Map Layers
layers.content: Switch between street, satellite, traffic and other views. Activate or deactivate layers as needed: incidents, units, patrol zones.
layers.tip: Customize visible layers from the layers button in the upper right corner.

search.title: Location Search
search.content: Use the search bar to find addresses, points of interest or specific coordinates. The map will automatically center on the result.

location.title: My Location
location.content: Click the "My location" button to center the map on your current position. The blue arrow indicates your direction.
location.tip: Make sure you have GPS enabled and have granted location permissions to the app.

markers.title: Custom Markers
markers.content: Right-click anywhere on the map to create a custom marker, add notes or mark important points of interest.
markers.tip: Markers sync between all your team members.

access.title: Access Chat
access.content: Inside any incident, you'll find the chat button at the bottom. Click to open the conversation window.
access.tip: The red indicator shows unread messages.

send.title: Send Messages
send.content: Type your message in the text field and press Enter or the send button. All incident participants will see your message instantly.

location.title: Share Location
location.content: Click the location icon to share your current position in the chat. Useful for coordinating meeting points or reporting your arrival.
location.tip: Shared location updates in real time for 5 minutes.

files.title: Attach Files
files.content: Use the clip icon to attach photos, videos or documents. Files are automatically compressed for fast sending.

important.title: Important Messages
important.content: Mark messages as important to highlight them. Useful for communicating critical information that should not be overlooked.
important.tip: Messages marked as urgent send a special notification to everyone.

access.title: Access Reports
access.content: From the main menu, select "Reports and Analysis". Here you'll find predefined templates and the option to create custom reports.
access.tip: Reports are generated in real time with the most up-to-date data.

type.title: Select Report Type
type.content: Choose between different types: incidents by period, unit performance, geographic analysis, response times or custom reports.

filters.title: Configure Filters
filters.content: Define date range, incident types, geographic zones, specific units and other criteria for your report.
filters.tip: Save frequent configurations as templates for future use.

view.title: Visualization
view.content: Data is presented in interactive charts, tables, heat maps and key statistics. You can switch between different views.

export.title: Export Report
export.content: Download your report in PDF, Excel or CSV format. You can schedule automatic reports to be sent by email periodically.
export.tip: PDF reports include charts and are ideal for presentations.

access.title: Access Settings
access.content: Click on your avatar in the upper right corner and select "Settings". The settings panel will open.
access.tip: Use Ctrl+, as a quick shortcut to open settings.

profile.title: User Profile
profile.content: Update your personal information: name, profile photo, position, emergency contact and communication preferences.

security.title: Security
security.content: Manage your security: change password, enable two-factor authentication, review active sessions and configure automatic lock.
security.tip: It is recommended to enable two-factor authentication for greater security.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.content: Customize how and when to receive notifications: critical alerts, chat messages, assignments, quiet hours and custom sounds.

preferences.title: App Preferences
preferences.content: Adjust theme (light/dark), language, units of measure, date/time format and performance settings according to your device.
preferences.tip: Dark mode helps save battery on mobile devices.
